title: Python Data Structures
description: Explore lists, dictionaries, sets, and tuples
starter:
# Python Data Structures
# Working with lists, dictionaries, sets, and tuples

# Lists - ordered, mutable collections
fruits = ["apple", "banana", "orange"]
print("Fruits:", fruits)
fruits.append("grape")
print("After adding grape:", fruits)

# Dictionaries - key-value pairs
student = {
    "name": "Alice",
    "age": 20,
    "grades": [85, 92, 78]
}
print("Student info:", student)
print("Student name:", student["name"])

# Try adding more data or experimenting with other data structures!
instructions: Learn about Python's built-in data structures! This lesson covers lists, dictionaries, sets, and tuples. Run the code to see examples, then try creating your own data structures and manipulating them.
